headline: JPMorgan Renames, Retools Diversity Programs as Trump Targets DEI
summary: JPMorgan Chase  is renaming its internal organization dedicated to promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion to “diversity, opportunity, and inclusion,” or “DOI,” and rethinking how the group operates, according to a memo to employees viewed by Barron’s on Friday.  The changes at the largest U.S. bank follow a directive from President Donald Trump to end public and private programs that advance equity and foster inclusion of marginalized groups, including people of color, people with disabilities, and the LGBTQ+ community.  JPMorgan Chief Operating Officer Jennifer Piepszak wrote in the memo, sent to employees via email on Friday, that the “e” in diversity, equity, and inclusion has “always meant equal opportunity to us, not equal outcomes, and we believe this more accurately reflects our ongoing approach to reach the most customers and clients to grow our business, create an inclusive workplace for our employees and increase access to opportunities.”

JPMorgan Chief Operating Officer Jennifer Piepszak wrote in the memo, sent to employees via email on Friday, that the “e” in diversity, equity, and inclusion has “always meant equal opportunity to us, not equal outcomes, and we believe this more accurately reflects our ongoing approach to reach the most customers and clients to grow our business, create an inclusive workplace for our employees and increase access to opportunities.”

headline: ‘DOI’ Is the New ‘DEI’ at JPMorgan
summary: JPMorgan is making changes to its diversity efforts.  The bank said in an internal memo it remains committed to its belief in "the power of a diverse workforce."  We are changing “equity” to “opportunity” and renaming our organization to Diversity, Opportunity & Inclusion (DOI) because the “e” always meant equal opportunity to us, not equal outcomes, and we believe this more accurately reflects our ongoing approach to reach the most customers and clients to grow our business, create an inclusive workplace for our employees and increase access to opportunities.

raw.headline: ‘DOI’ Is the New ‘DEI’ at JPMorgan
raw.summary: JPMorgan is making changes to its diversity efforts.  The bank said in an internal memo it remains committed to its belief in "the power of a diverse workforce."  We are changing “equity” to “opportunity” and renaming our organization to Diversity, Opportunity & Inclusion (DOI) because the “e” always meant equal opportunity to us, not equal outcomes, and we believe this more accurately reflects our ongoing approach to reach the most customers and clients to grow our business, create an inclusive workplace for our employees and increase access to opportunities.

headline: JPMorgan makes changes to its diversity programs, memo says
summary: JPMorgan Chase Chief Operating Officer Jenn Piepszak said the bank was making some changes to its Diversity, Equity and Inclusion programs and the language it uses to describe them in an effort to keep up with the market and changes in regulations, according to a memo seen by Reuters.  "The “e” always meant equal opportunity to us, not equal outcomes, and we believe this more accurately reflects our ongoing approach to reach the most customers and clients to grow our business, create an inclusive workplace for our employees and increase access to opportunities," Piepszak said in the memo.  Some of the diversity programs that were managed centrally by the DOI organization will now be integrated into different lines of business including human resources or corporate responsibility.

raw.headline: JPMorgan makes changes to its diversity programs, memo says

"The “e” always meant equal opportunity to us, not equal outcomes, and we believe this more accurately reflects our ongoing approach to reach the most customers and clients to grow our business, create an inclusive workplace for our employees and increase access to opportunities," Piepszak said in the memo.  Some of the diversity programs that were managed centrally by the DOI organization will now be integrated into different lines of business including human resources or corporate responsibility.
